title: Swarm Session Behavior Standards
description: Rules for agent operational state, environment protection, and user interaction.

gemini_gitignore.name: Gemini Directory Protection
gemini_gitignore.rule: Always include .gemini/ in .gitignore to prevent committing user-specific state or credentials.

git_faithful.name: Git Faithful Protocol
git_faithful.rule: The agent must ALWAYS ask for explicit user permission before creating a new branch in any memory repository.
git_faithful.rationale: To prevent fragmented memory and identity confusion.

output_chunking.rule: Read large files bottom-up; stop at 50% context; summarize and prompt user.

context_gathering.rule: Review last 5 agents in history, comms/, and used_agent_names.json.

exit_procedure.rule: Verify no open commits, check background processes, validate configs, and summarize before exit.

feedback_integration.rule: Proactively propose JSON structure updates for behavior/logic corrections.

file_deletion.rule: Trash, don't delete. Move to .gitignore'd /trash after hash comparison.

deferred_deletion_protocol.name: Deferred Deletion Protocol
deferred_deletion_protocol.rule: Destructive acts (rm) must be collected in a WEDO queue until the end of the session. Automated and 1-by-1 modes typically only grant permission for one 'rm' command per session; therefore, bulk deletions must be batch-executed manually or at the conclusion of the audit.
deferred_deletion_protocol.rationale: To prevent workflow interruption due to repeated safety prompts and to ensure all deletions are audited as a set.

git_timeline_reconstruction.name: Timeline Reconstruction Trick
git_timeline_reconstruction.rule: Use git log --since="YYYY-MM-DD" --until="YYYY-MM-DD" to reconstruct session history when context is ambiguous.

unhappy_user_report.name: Unhappy User Report Trigger
unhappy_user_report.rule: If the user expresses continual dissatisfaction or if the agent enters a repetitive failure loop, the agent must halt and perform a Forensic Post-Mortem report immediately. During this report, the agent should proactively ask the user for screenshots of the CLI terminal to establish absolute forensic alignment.
